amplify.value:
v. 增加，放大 （声音、范围、重要性）：to make larger or greater (as in amount, importance, or intensity)
v. 详述，补充说明：to expand (as a statement) by the use of detail or illustration or by closer analysis

anecdote.value: n. 轶事，趣闻；秘闻，秘史：a usually short narrative of an interesting, amusing, or biographical incident

anodyne.value:
n. 平淡无奇的；平淡乏味的：watered-down; insipid
n. 能解除或减轻忧愁的（事物）；止痛剂：something that soothes, calms, or comforts; a medicine that relieves pain

antagonistic.value: adj. 反对的；敌对的：acting against or in opposition

antedate.value: v. 先于，发生于…以前：to be of an earlier date than; precede in time

applaud.value:

apprehension.value:
n. 担心；忧虑；恐惧：Apprehension is a feeling of fear that something bad may happen
n. 捕获：the act of seizing or capturing; arrest
n. 理解;领悟 The apprehension of something is awareness and understanding of it.

approach.value:
n. 方法：a method of doing something or dealing with a problem
v.(n.) 接近：to come close to, as in appearance, quality, or condition; approximate
v. 着手，开始处理：to begin to deal with or work on

apt.value:

adj. 适当的：unusually fitted or qualified 
adj. 聪明的：quick to learn or understand

arresting.value:
adj. 引人注目的：attracting and holding the attention; striking

arrogant.value: adj. 傲慢的；自负的：making or disposed to make claims to unwarranted importance or consideration out of overbearing pride

artlessness.value:

adj. 拙劣的；无教养的：lacking art, knowledge, or skill; uncultured and ignorant

v. 确定；确定；弄清：to discover with certainty, as through examination or experimentation
【考】ascertained

v. 深受…困扰;使极为苦恼：if you are assailed by something unpleasant such as fears or problems, you are greatly troubled by a large number of them.

assertive.value:
adj. 自信的；观点明确的：inclined to bold or confident assertion; aggressively self-assured.

baffle.value:

banality.value: n.乏味；陈词滥调：something that is trite, obvious, or predictable; a commonplace

【注】Baroque 巴洛克风格的：约1550到1700年间盛行于欧洲的一种艺术和建筑风格，属于、关于或有这种风格的特点的。这种风格强调戏剧效果，特征是有大胆的曲线结构、复杂的装饰和完全不同部分之间的整体协调。

comparable.value:
adj. 类似的；相当的：similar or equivalent
adj. 可比较的：admitting of comparison with another or others
【注】该词在考试中，经常考查的意思是“相似的，类似的”等，为比较逻辑，比如官方真题：The cases are not precisely analogous. There were serious problems with the pre-drift world view that a drift theory could help to resolve, whereas Earth expansion appears to offer no comparable advantages. 大陆漂移理论提出之前的世界观存在着种种严重的问题，而漂移理论就能够有助于解决这些问题。而地球膨胀理论似乎不能提供什么类似的优点。

complacency.value: n. 自满；未意识到危险或不足：self-satisfaction especially when accompanied by unawareness of actual dangers or deficiencies

n.  A 化合物：pure, macroscopically homogeneous substance 
v. 使恶化；使复杂化；加重：to compound a problem, difficulty, or mistake means to make it worse by adding to it
【注】在阅读中，compound还可以表示复合字：包含有两个或多个独立字的字，例如loudspeaker, baby-sit 或 high school， 或是由特殊变形词混合成的，例如希腊字 philosophia 就是由 philo- 意为“爱”，和 sophia 意为“智慧”组合而成

polemical.value: adj. 好争论的，争辩的；辩论的：engaged in or addicted to polemics : disputatious

portentous.value:
adj. 预示未来的；影响重大的：of the nature of or constituting a portent; foreboding
adj. 自命不凡的，装腔作势的：self-consciously solemn or important : pompous 
【考】portent；portentous

portray.value:
v. 描写：to depict or describe in words 
v. 饰演：to represent dramatically, as on the stage
【考】portrayed

pragmatism.value: n. 实用主义；务实主义：a practical, matter-of-fact way of approaching or assessing situations or of solving problems

pragmatist.value: n. 实用主义者：a person who takes a practical approach to problems and is concerned primarily with the success or failure of her actions

precipitate.value:
v. 导致突然发生；导致：to cause to happen, especially suddenly or prematurely
v. 沉淀：to be separated from a solution as a solid
adj. 贸然的，突然的，仓促的：moving rapidly and heedlessly; speeding headlong

precocious.value: adj. 早熟的；智慧超前的：manifesting or characterized by unusually early development or maturity, especially in mental aptitude

precursor.value:
n. 先兆，预兆：one that precedes and indicates, suggests, or announces someone or something to come
n. 先驱者；先驱：one that precedes another; a forerunner or predecessor

predator.value:
n. 食肉动物：an organism that lives by preying on other organisms
【例】 the relationship between predator and prey 捕食性动物与猎物之间的关系

predicament.value: n. 困境；艰难的处境；尴尬的境地：a situation, especially an unpleasant, troublesome, or trying one, from which extrication is difficult

predilection.value: n. 偏爱，偏袒：a partiality or disposition in favor of something; a preference

premise.value:
n. 前提：a proposition upon which an argument is based or from which a conclusion is drawn
v. 假设，预设命题：to state or assume as a proposition in an argument

prestige.value:
n. 声望：the level of respect at which one is regarded by others; standing
【派】prestigious  adj. 有威望的，有声望的
【考】prestigious

presume.value:
v. 假设；假定：to take for granted as being true in the absence of proof to the contrary
v. 认为，相信，推测：if you presume that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you are not certain
【考】presumed

presumptuous.value:
adj. 放肆的，冒失的；自作主张的：going beyond what is right or proper; excessively forward
【考】presumptuousness

pretension.value: n. 自命不凡；矫饰，夸耀：ostentatious display; pretentiousness

prey.value:
v. 捕食：to hunt, catch, or eat as prey
n. 猎物；捕食对象：an animal hunted or caught for food; quarry

primitive.value:
adj. 简陋的，简陋的：characterized by simplicity or crudity; unsophisticated
adj. 原始的；远古的；未开化的：not derived from something else; primary or basic

pristine.value:
adj. 质朴的，纯洁的：remaining in a pure state; uncorrupted by civilization
adj. 新鲜的或清洁的；干净的：remaining free from dirt or decay; clean
adj. 太古的，原始的：of, relating to, or typical of the earliest time or condition; primitive or original

privation.value: n. 匮乏：lack of the basic necessities or comforts of life

probity.value: n. 诚实，正直：complete and confirmed integrity; uprightness

proclivity.value: n. 倾向，偏好，嗜好：a natural propensity or inclination; predisposition

prodigal.value:
adj. 挥霍的，浪费的：rashly or wastefully extravagant
adj. 慷慨的，丰富的：giving or given in abundance; lavish or profuse
【派】prodigality  n. 挥霍；丰富；慷慨
【考】prodigality

profitability.value: n. 收益性； 利益率：the quality of affording gain or benefit or profit

prolific.value:
adj. （作家、画家或作曲家）多产的，作品丰富的：producing abundant works or results
adj. 多育的，多产的，高产的：producing offspring or fruit in great abundance; fertile

proprietary.value:
adj. 私人的，私有的：exclusively owned; private
adj. 所有（人）的：of or relating to a proprietor or to proprietors as a group

quandary.value: n. 困境；窘境；左右为难的境地：a state of uncertainty or perplexity

quantifiable.value: adj. 可以定量的；能量化的：able to be measured or counted in a scientific way

rapacious.value: adj. 贪婪的；贪得无厌的；自私的：if you describe a person or their behaviour as rapacious, you disapprove of their greedy or selfish behaviour

recede.value:
v. 退，后退：to move back or away from a limit, point, or mark
v. 下降，减小：to grow less or smaller : diminish, decrease

reconcile.value:
v. 解决，调停：to settle or resolve
v. 使和好：to reestablish a close relationship between
v. 调和，使兼容，使一致：to make compatible or consistent
v. 顺从；接受；将就：to bring (oneself) to accept
【考】 reconciled

redolent.value:
adj. 有…气味的：having or emitting fragrance; aromatic
adj. 使人想起…的；使人联想到…的：suggestive; reminiscent

refute.value:
v. 反驳：to prove wrong by argument or evidence : show to be false or erroneous    
【考】refuted

regrettable.value: adj. 令人后悔的；令人遗憾的；可惜的：eliciting or deserving regret

reiterate.value:
v. 重复，重申： to say or do again or repeatedly
【考】reiterates；reiterated

relentless.value:
adj. 严酷或严格方面不屈从的，不宽容的：unyielding in severity or strictness; unrelenting
adj. 不停的；不懈的；不间断的；未减轻的：steady and persistent; unremitting
【注】relentlessly: 没完没了地 endlessly；例如：It is puzzling to observe that Jones's novel has recently been criticized for its lack of structure, since commentators have traditionally argued that its most obvious flaw is its relentlessly rigid, indeed schematic, framework.
【考】relentless ；unrelenting

reliable.value: adj. 可靠的；可信赖的：giving the same result on successive trials

renew.value:
v. 使更新；使恢复：to make new or as if new again; restore
v. 重新开始；继续：to take up again; resume
v. 复原；恢复：to regain or restore the physical or mental vigor of; revive
【考】renewed

renowned.value: adj. 有名的；有声望的：having renown; famous

replete.value: adj. 充满的，装满的：abundantly supplied; abounding

reputation.value: n. 名誉，名声：the general estimation in which a person is held by the public

resemble.value: v. 类似，与…相似，与…相像：to be like or similar to
